description: Display of static illuminated fascia sign on frontage of Publc House
decision_conditions: 1.  The consent shall expire after 5 years from the date of this notice.  2.  Any advertisements displayed, and any site used for the display of advertisements, shall be maintained in a clean and tidy condition to the reasonable satisfaction of the Local Planning Authority.  3.  Any structure or hoarding erected or used principally for the purpose of displaying advertisements shall be maintained in a safe condition.  4.  Where an advertisement is required under these Regulations to be removed, the removal shall be carried out to the reasonable satisfaction of the Local Planning Authority.  5.  No advertisement is to be displayed without the permission of the owner of the site or any other person with an interest in the site entitled to grant permission.  6.  No advertisement shall be sited or displayed so as to obscure, or hinder the ready interpretation of, any road traffic sign, railway signal or aid to navigation by water or air, or so as otherwise to render hazardous the use of any highway, waterway (including any coastal waters) or aerodrome (civil or military). | The intensity of the illumination shall not exceed 200 lumens.  REASON:	In the interest of amenity and/or highway safety. | The illuminated advertisement(s) permitted shall not be illuminated outside 11.00pm to 8.00am hours Monday to Friday, 11.00pm to 8:00am hours on Saturday and not at any time on Sundays or Bank or Public Holidays.
